moduleTitle: Short Course: Franz Kafka - The Novel of Institution
moduleDescription: A predominant pattern in Western epics has been the ”Novel of Formation” (Bildungsroman) – the novel that follows an individual through the stages of her life. The last century has seen a radical reversal. Instead of narrating a life’s development, the new novel concentrates on the institution that shapes individuals and renders them subjects (school, bureaucracy, court of law etc.). The German-Czech writer Kafka is the master of the new genre. The course highlights Kafka’s “The Trial” as a “novel of institution” while drawing on related works including “The Castle,” and exploring concepts such as “institution,” “novel,” “form of life.”
